ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Wrestling with arc files left open
ygData.msgSnippet: What Erik says, but also: if you can reliably reproduce a situation where the job finishes but ARCs are left with the .open suffix, please let us know, and

What Erik says, but also: if you can reliably reproduce a situation 
where the job finishes but ARCs are left with the ".open" suffix, please 
let us know, and examine the heritrix_out.log to see if there are 
indications of an error preventing the normal end-of-job tidying from 
completing.

Normally, if the web UI shows the job as having finished, all its files 
should be closed; all '.open' files renamed; and end-of-crawl reports 
dumped to the job directory.

- Gordon

Erik Hetzner wrote:
> At Sun, 07 Jun 2009 01:21:45 -0000,
> bowser.richard wrote:
>> Hi all. I'm still working with heritrix-1.14.1. I'm already ALMOST
>> up to beginner status! At this time, I'm having problems when a
>> crawl job hits its max-document-download limit. Given a reasonably
>> hefty download limit, heritrix generates several arc.gz files - but
>> the process usually leaves one final arc.gz.open file. For me, this
>> has prevented recovery of the last .arc file for processing by
>> bin/arcreader, which demands its input in a .arc file. Does anybody
>> know if its possible to persuade heritrix to close a still-open
>> archive file on exit? Does anybody know how?
>>
>> Any suggestions would be welcome.
> 
> Heritrix should close all open arc files on exit but often doesnâ€™t,
> for some reason. In any case it is generally safe, in my experience,
> to simply rename the files to .arc.gz, the worst problem you are
> liable to encounter is some trailing garbage.
> 
> best,
> Erik Hetzner
> 
>
